definitions.definition: To furnish proof of, to show .
examples: This certificate witnesses his presence on that day.

definitions.definition: To see or gain knowledge of through experience.
To present personal religious testimony ; to preach at (someone) or on behalf of.
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , construed with to or for

definitions.definition: To see the execution of (a legal instrument), and subscribe it for the purpose of establishing its authenticity .
examples: to witness a bond or a deed

main_definition: ( transitive ) To furnish proof of, to show .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To see or gain knowledge of through experience.
( intransitive , construed with to or for ) To present personal religious testimony ; to preach at (someone) or on behalf of.
To see the execution of (a legal instrument), and subscribe it for the purpose of establishing its authenticity .
